fact_check_explanation_title: This picture of a bus warning about childhood strokes wasn’t taken in the UK
fact_check_explanation_summary: The picture is from a campaign by a Canadian charity raising awareness about strokes in children.

fact_check_explanation_title: Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla has not been arrested for vaccine data fraud
fact_check_explanation_summary: There’s no evidence this happened—Pfizer says the claim is false and he was not arrested.

fact_check_explanation_title: You can’t recharge an electric car by attaching a generator to the wheel
fact_check_explanation_summary: The reason no one has manufactured a self-charging electric car is it would break the laws of physics.

fact_check_explanation_title: Photo of smiley face in forest is real
fact_check_explanation_summary: A photo of an orange smiley face in the middle of a forest was deliberately planted by a timber company.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook offer to buy a Dyson hair dryer for £1.78 is fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on social media falsely claims that Currys is selling Dyson hair dryers for £1.78.

fact_check_explanation_title: Molnupiravir and ivermectin are not the same
fact_check_explanation_summary: Both drugs are produced by Merck, but that doesn’t mean that they are the same.

fact_check_explanation_title: Be wary of claims Covid-19 deaths “soar” on Tuesdays
fact_check_explanation_summary: Reporting delays mean that the headline figure for Covid-19 deaths is always high on Tuesdays—and low on Sundays and Mondays.

fact_check_explanation_title: Brexit hasn’t quadrupled the cost of fuel for fishing boats
fact_check_explanation_summary: An old social media post, which is being shared again, claims that Brexit would cause the cost of fuel used by fishing boats to more than quadruple. This is not …

fact_check_explanation_title: Italy hasn’t changed its Covid-19 death toll from 130,000 to under 4,000
fact_check_explanation_summary: Contrary to various online claims, the Italian health authority has done nothing of the sort.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence people are trying to kill with fentanyl-laced tape on cars
fact_check_explanation_summary: Even if they were, touching ‘contaminated’ tape wouldn’t be fatal.

fact_check_explanation_title: Study linking sleep time and heart disease risk shows correlation not causation
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Mail reported that a new study shows going to bed between 10pm and 11pm cuts your risk of heart disease. The study found a link between the two but …

fact_check_explanation_title: Emissions from COP26 private jets are far, far lower than Scotland’s annual CO2 output
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims on Twitter seriously misunderstand a headline which equates private jet emissions to the emissions of just 1,600 Scots.
